strings.Value: "Yes. I'll put an end to this nightmare very soon."
"Here is the real question — is he ready to die? For that's what awaits him at my hands."
"Brrrace up, {race} — the throne rrroom is nearr. Arre you ready to meet grrrreat Vordakai? Arrre you ready to accept the gift of serrrving my masterrr?"

"My masterrr awaits. But beforre you enterrr his prrresence…" {n}The crow scans your band.{/n} "Vordakai has no use for the weak, nor any who beg for merrrcy… but he sees value in using such souls as herrrralds for his coming. The question…" {n}The crow makes a croak, as if sneering.{/n} "Is who is weakest among you? Who should be sent away, disrrrregarded — pick the weakest among you to fly from here in fearrr and serrrve Vordakai in their flight? The grrreat Vordakai will let them keep theirrr lives – but makes no promises afterrr this."

{n}Nok-Nok, who has been strangely quiet… and now that you notice, has a hungry gleam in his eye as he watches the raven… suddenly speaks.{/n} "This Vordakai is truly great? Then Nok-Nok will allow him to serve and learn to be truly-truly great. Price of lesson cheap, only cost Vordakai..." {n}He studies the raven, then licks his lips.{/n} "One raven."
"Whaaat? What you trying to say, crow? My name is Amiri, and I'll kick him into dust then pour him back in his coffin."

"Oh, so this Vordakai of yours… he wants us to spread tales about him?" {n}Linzi shakes her head.{/n} "No, no, I am Linzi, the {mf|baron's|baroness'} chronicler, not this Vordakai's. No matter what your 'master' commands, he won't merit a footnote in my chronicle — or any other!" {n}Linzi's face, set in a frown, suddenly relaxes.{/n} "But — if I did, is it 'Vordakai' with a 'k' 'a' 'i" or a 'k' 'i' at the end? Details, you know."

"I volunteered to go with the {mf|baron|baroness}, and I will stand with {mf|him|her} until the end. I am Tristian, and you may inform your master…" {n}Tristian's voice takes on an edge.{/n} "The light of {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g} will soon cut through the darkness of this tomb."
"If the death of the {mf|baron|broness} is near, my, Harrim's, duty is to follow {mf|him|her} down the same path. That honor is mine, rightfully earned."
{n}The raven makes no response — it peers at you a moment, then caws loudly and takes flight into the darkness.{/n}
